oscilloscup.system

Class BoundedSpaceElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • oscilloscup.system.SpaceElement
      • oscilloscup.system.BoundedSpaceElement
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AxisLine, Dimension, Graduation

    public class BoundedSpaceElement
extends SpaceElement

    The space object is made of (and itself is) bounded by numeric values.

    The mathematical concept of space does not talk about an interval but here we have to render the graphical representation of the space and so it is no possible to consider the whole space: we want to display only the interval required by the user.

    A bounded graphical element is a graphical element plus the conception of interval. This is used only for rendering. This class only brings the concept of interval used for painting.

    Knowing that the interval may be automatically deduced from the user data or even from the parent bounded graphical elements, we assume that a bounded graphical element can be auto bounded.

    Note: the bounds values are inclusive (ex: [-1, 1])

      • getMin

        public double getMin()
        Returns:
        the minimum value for the bounds. This cannot be lower than the maximum value.

      • setMin

        public void setMin(double min)
        Sets the minimum value of the bounds. It cannot be set to a greater value than the maximum one. Manually setting the bound implies that the element is no more (it is was) auto bounded.

      • getMax

        public double getMax()
        Returns:
        the maximum value for the bounds. This cannot be greater than the minimum value.

      • setMax

        public void setMax(double max)
        Sets the maximum value of the bounds. It cannot be set to a lower value than the minimum one. Manually setting the bound implies that the element is no more (it is was) auto bounded.

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(double min,
                      double max)
        Sets the bounds. Obviously, min must be lower than max.

      • isVisibleAt

        public boolean isVisibleAt(double position)
        Returns:
        if the graphical element is visible at the given position.
